definition.name: NXsensor
definition.doc:
A sensor used to monitor an external condition
The condition itself is described in :ref:`NXenvironment`.

field.name: short_name
field.doc: Short name of sensor used e.g. on monitor display program

group.name: geometry
group.deprecated: Use the field `depends_on` and :ref:`NXtransformations` to position the beamstop and NXoff_geometry to describe its shape instead
group.doc: Defines the axes for logged vector quantities if they are not the global instrument axes.

field.name: type
field.doc:
The type of hardware used for the measurement. Examples (suggestions but not restrictions):
:Temperature: J | K | T | E | R | S | Pt100 | Pt1000 | Rh/Fe :pH: Hg/Hg2Cl2 | Ag/AgCl | ISFET :Ion selective electrode: specify species; e.g. Ca2+ :Magnetic field: Hall :Surface pressure: wilhelmy plate

field.name: run_control
field.doc: Is data collection controlled or synchronised to this quantity: 1=no, 0=to "value", 1=to "value_deriv1", etc.

field.name: high_trip_value
field.doc: Upper control bound of sensor reading if using run_control

field.name: low_trip_value
field.doc: Lower control bound of sensor reading if using run_control

field.name: value
field.doc: nominal setpoint or average value - need [n] as may be a vector

field.name: value_deriv1
field.doc: Nominal/average first derivative of value e.g. strain rate - same dimensions as "value" (may be a vector)

field.name: value_deriv2
field.doc: Nominal/average second derivative of value - same dimensions as "value" (may be a vector)

group.name: value_deriv1_log
group.doc: Time history of first derivative of sensor readings

group.name: value_deriv2_log
group.doc: Time history of second derivative of sensor readings

group.name: external_field_full
group.doc: For complex external fields not satisfied by External_field_brief
This group describes the shape of the sensor when necessary.

attribute.name: default
attribute.doc:
.. index:: plotting
Declares which child group contains a path leading to a :ref:`NXdata` group.
It is recommended (as of NIAC2014) to use this attribute to help define the path to the default dataset to be plotted. See https://www.nexusformat.org/2014_How_to_find_default_data.html for a summary of the discussion.

field.name: depends_on
field.doc:
NeXus positions components by applying a set of translations and rotations to apply to the component starting from 0, 0, 0. The order of these operations is critical and forms what NeXus calls a dependency chain. The depends_on field defines the path to the top most operation of the dependency chain or the string "." if located in the origin. Usually these operations are stored in a NXtransformations group. But NeXus allows them to be stored anywhere.
.. todo:: Add a definition for the reference point of a sensor.

group.doc: This is the group recommended for holding the chain of translation and rotation operations necessary to position the component within the instrument. The dependency chain may however traverse similar groups in other component groups.
